page.title: 01 Otley and its surroundings
page.content: The area under review is typical of much of East Anglia in that it is an area of predominantly arable farming. Although the square contains the village of Otley itself the overall pattern remains agricultural.The farms are typical in that the farmers produce crops which reflect the current subsidies available.Generally speaking the crops are a mixture of barley,beans,oilseed rape,wheat etc. The local people are a close knit group with mutual interests.Not surprisingly the pattern of education is of great concern,equally important is retaining the character of the area. Of current interest is a proposal to amend the pattern of education by replacing a three tier system with a two tier pattern
